p: (2) Chemical Structure. Oleandrine (oleandroside) is a cardiotonic glycoside derived from an aglycone, oleandrigenin (16-acetylgitoxigenin), and a sugar oleandrose (2-deoxy-3-O-methylrhamnose), of the empirical formula C 32H 48O 9. Pure oleandrin is in the form of colorless, odorless, and very bitter crystals. It is soluble in chloroform and ethanol and insoluble in water. See Figure 12.
